Package com.arkavquarium.utility

Class Utility

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arkavquarium.utility.Utility

  • public class Utility
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class is a class that contains static methods to help calculating things more easily.

    This includes:

    • Calculating Euclidean distance from one point to another
    • Determining movement direction
    • Changing object position based on the radian the object is facing
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Adylan Roaffa

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Utility​()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static double getDistanceObj​(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Returns the Euclidean distance using the formula sqrt( (x2-x1)^2 + (y2-y1)^2 ).
      static double getMovementDirection​(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Returns the angle in radian from the defined two points relative to the first points.
      static double moveXByRadian​(int x, double v, double rad, double t)
      Change the horizontal position value based on the moving direction and speed.
      static double moveYByRadian​(int y, double v, double rad, double t)
      Change the vertical position value based on the moving direction and speed.

    • Method Detail

      • getDistanceObj

        public static double getDistanceObj​(int x1,
                                    int y1,
                                    int x2,
                                    int y2)
        Returns the Euclidean distance using the formula sqrt( (x2-x1)^2 + (y2-y1)^2 ).
        Parameters:
        x1 - horizontal position of point 1
        y1 - vertical position of point 1
        x2 - horizontal position of point 2
        y2 - vertical position of point 2
        Returns:
        Euclidean distance between the defined points

      • getMovementDirection

        public static double getMovementDirection​(int x1,
                                          int y1,
                                          int x2,
                                          int y2)
        Returns the angle in radian from the defined two points relative to the first points.
        Parameters:
        x1 - horizontal position of point 1
        y1 - vertical position of point 1
        x2 - horizontal position of point 2
        y2 - vertical position of point 2
        Returns:
        angle in radian

      • moveXByRadian

        public static double moveXByRadian​(int x,
                                   double v,
                                   double rad,
                                   double t)
        Change the horizontal position value based on the moving direction and speed.
        Parameters:
        x - horizontal position
        v - speed
        rad - moving direction in radian
        t - time
        Returns:
        new horizontal position

      • moveYByRadian

        public static double moveYByRadian​(int y,
                                   double v,
                                   double rad,
                                   double t)
        Change the vertical position value based on the moving direction and speed.
        Parameters:
        y - vertical position
        v - speed
        rad - moving direction in radian
        t - time
        Returns:
        new vertical position
